column1: 2/2 Today I give thanks for the opportunity to serve this beautiful district and our great Nation. I give thanks for my family my friends and the grace of God shining upon us. We have evolved this year as a country and we will get stronger.

1/2 As difficult a year 2020 has been for our nation we have endured and we have much for which to be thankful. We have seen darker days and survived. We will survive these days as well. https://t.co/xOSyhn7vIC
2/2 Plan accordingly and if you need help please visit SCE’s website: https://t.co/EdUwwsj9Te

1/2 If you are like many #CA25 residents you most likely just received a notice that you are subject to SCE’s PSPS warnings running from Thanksgiving until Friday.  We deserve better than these power shutdowns but be prepared. https://t.co/m3LMg1taSs
4/4 For help preparing for PSPS please visit SCE’s website: https://t.co/5EOCKLSrRD

3/4 I have been discussing with SCE the need to enhance our power grid and minimize our fire risk exposure in CA-25 so we can avoid PSPS shutdowns altogether.   They are not there yet.   In the meantime please make preparations accordingly.
2/4 The areas that may be impacted are Palmdale & the Unincorporated County Areas of Escondido Canyon Rd between Aqua Dulce Canyon and Acton;  Kashmere Canyon; Boiling Point.
1/4 Southern California Edison (SCE) just contacted my office to inform us that there may be an imminent PSPS power shut down. It may last between 1 to 4 hrs.

We lost an icon of kindness last night. Cheri Fleming was a bright light and pillar of the philanthropic community in addition to a successful business owner. My thoughts are with Cheri's family and husband Don Fleming; Cheri and Don are dear friends and will be in my prayers.
2/2 Many hands make for light work and helping hands of #charity can support a community for years to come. https://t.co/riAou9Resw

1/2 I am glad I could be a part of the Free Food Giveaway put on by the office of Supervisor @kathrynbarger @LAFoodBank and @CountyofLA today at Castaic.   Together with volunteers from the community and Friends of Castaic Lake we provided 1471 households with food. https://t.co/IrGOzvnknb
Together we celebrate the 245th Birthday of the @USMC. Once a #Marine always a Marine. Semper Fidelis https://t.co/8konE2KBQc

4/4 When you arrive in your car please follow the posted signs to the pick-up area and wear a mask. Please do not line-up earlier than 8:30 a.m. and do not come on foot. Learn about more free food resources at https://t.co/KYWmubpB1L

3/4 This drive-through giveaway provides family-sized boxes of free food to community members brought to you by the @LAFoodBank @CountyofLA  and @kathrynbarger. There are no eligibility requirements and the event is open to all.
2/4 FREE FOOD FOR FAMILIES! Join us on Tuesday November 10 from 9 a.m. to 12 p.m. at the Castaic Lake State Recreation Area (32132 Castaic Lake Drive Castaic 91384). https://t.co/rdvfBWuPfQ

1/4 I look forward to supporting this event tomorrow in Castaic. I’ll be passing out food with our team. While we are still under COVID-19 restrictions it is #Charity that provides practical help to support our neighbors in times of need. https://t.co/TzxIaRDrT3

#CA25: There is still time to register for federal disaster relief if your home was damaged during the #BobcatFire   Residents in Los Angeles county have until December 16th to complete a federal disaster assistance application.  More information: https://t.co/jSfF1ujYa0. https://t.co/czhx6dUfUN

3/4 Also on the SCE website you can check to see: * Where the power shutoffs are. * Which areas are under consideration. * Where the Community Crew Vehicles are. * Where Community Resources Centers are. * Guidelines on planning and monitoring the outages.
3/4 Don't get left in the dark - visit https://t.co/5EOCKLAQt3 or call 800-655-4555 to sign up for text phone or email alerts:

2/4 Residents of the Acton/Agua Dulce area have electric pumps on their water wells no electricity equals no water and water is life. Imagine going 2-3 days without electricity to charge or power your medical device such as a portable oxygen tank or power wheelchair.

1/4 Southern California Edison continues to have Public Safety Power Shutoffs (PSPS). The shutoffs come w. very little notice & can cause dangerous situations for constituents of #CA25. https://t.co/gRREKKg1Ew
2/2 This project will allow those living in the Vista Canyon development the ability to experience a live work walk and ride community. https://t.co/8UZemlz0Y3

1/2Yesterday I attended the Vista Canyon Metrolink Station groundbreaking & new parking structure ribbon cutting. Our community is fortunate to have a city that makes it a priority to provide alternative means of transportation to help ease congestion on our overcrowded freeways https://t.co/1jqWIMv2wn

Simi Valley a beautiful part of California’s 25th District lost one of its finest citizens today Debbie Thomas. Debbie Thomas was a dear friend of mine. Today my thoughts and prayers are with her husband Fred Thomas and the family.

4/4 My Bobcat Fire Updates page on my website is current with the information you need to apply for disaster assistance. Visit https://t.co/qOCPHH5D82 or contact one of my three field offices for additional guidance.
3/4 There is now a clear path for disaster relief and Californians affected by these fires can access the resources they need.
2/4 I was glad to see the President’s decision to reverse FEMA’s denial of the request to make sure needed resources can quickly get to those affected by the recent fires including the Bobcat Fire.

1/4 I have consistently advocated for increased federal assistance for California since the beginning of this devastating wildfire season including sending a letter to the President asking him to approve the most recent disaster relief request from CA.

I will not support any moves to take away coverage of pre-existing conditions. I believe in a better health care future for all Californians and I am committed to fighting for reforms that expand consumer choice and access to care while reducing cost and enhancing transparency. https://t.co/bpJ1C8rnDi
I am proud that I sent a letter to President Trump in support of CA’s request for disaster relief. I’m glad the President decided to reverse FEMA’s decision clearing a path for disaster relief.
2/2 Thank you for hosting me and meeting your incredible team that provides excellent products and service to CA25. https://t.co/neCvnGpXFD

1/2 This month we celebrate the contributions the Latino community makes in our country. I’m happy to have met the hardworking & successful employees of @ToyotaLancaster from Shop Manager Jorge Castaneda Employee of the Month Refugio Garcia & their online support team. https://t.co/QFcV5fzJvz
2/2 My time in the Navy shaped me into the person I am today and for that I am grateful.  Join me in celebrating the Navy’s 245th #birthday today!!

1/2 I spent nearly 20 years serving my country in the @USNavy as a fighter pilot. I stood shoulder to shoulder with some of the finest men and women #America has to offer and I take pride in my service to this great country the greatest country on Earth. https://t.co/19WImUa1oQ

2/2 A peaceful resolution for Armenian sovereignty and stability must be reached to prevent further deaths of innocent civilians and I stand firmly with innocent Armenian citizens who are the victims of this aggression.
1/2 I joined the Armenian Caucus in signing a letter to Sec. Pompeo expressing deep concern with Azerbaijan’s recent use of force against Armenia. https://t.co/BPD9yoXs3O

Today I went to the House Floor to force a vote on a bill that would unlock $138 billion in unspent PPP funds that could go to struggling businesses right away. Once again my efforts were blocked due to partisan politics. I'll keep fighting to ensure this money is released ASAP

It is an honor to serve the constituents of California’s 25th District. My top priority is excellent constituent service. I have opened three field offices in my first 60 days of service and now my staff is quickly resolving constituent cases. https://t.co/XLYMbYn4uM

The #BobcatFire has burned over 100000 acres destroyed over 100 homes & injured at least 6. Today I sent a letter to the President in support of CA’s request for a another major disaster declaration to ensure our communities have the resources they need to combat this threat. https://t.co/edhM6s0Bo5

--Allow the $138 billion to go to struggling businesses --Allow small businesses to take a second PPP loan if they show 25% revenue loss --Simplify the PPP loan forgiveness process --Extend the PPP until December 31 2020

Democrats continue to block allocation of $138 billion in unused PPP funds. Today I was one of the first to sign onto a discharge petition to force a vote on a bill that would: https://t.co/Vg43diquho

Today I voted in favor of a bipartisan amendment pkg that would strengthen the grid & increase wildfire preparedness & mitigation for Californians facing the threat of wildfires. As wildfires continue to rage in CA we must continue to address these important issues in the House. https://t.co/XfuG4eY9rn
If you are impacted by the #BobcatFire or live in an evacuation zone visit https://t.co/Svo8hM6eH3 for resources and updates. https://t.co/8XZzDt8CPR

2/2 That’s why I cosponsored the Gig Worker Equity Compensation Act this week in the House which will preserve the flexibility the gig workforce needs and preempt job-killing bills like AB5 from creeping to the national level.

1/2 As millions of Californians remain unemployed due to COVID-19 CA state government is pushing ahead with implementation of the devastating AB5 which will kill an additional hundreds of thousands of jobs. We can’t let this also happen at the federal level.

2/2 Over $100 billion in COVID relief funding is available to be provided to struggling businesses right away but for political reasons this funding continues to sit unused. Congress must set politics aside and come together for the American people.
1/2 Today I voted to move toward reopening the vital Paycheck Protection Program. Unfortunately Democrats blocked this effort.

Residents needing animal care support can go to the following locations: Large Animals Antelope Valley Fairgrounds: 2551 W Avenue H Lancaster Dogs Cats & Small Animals Lancaster Animal Care Center (ACC): 5210 W Ave I Lancaster Palmdale ACC: 38550 Sierra Hwy Palmdale

2/2 The Virtual Evacuation Line continues to remain active & supportive in processing residents who are within the mandatory evacuation zone. That number is 800-675-5799.   Residents are urged to remain alert for any additional evacuation orders or warnings that may be issued.

1/2 Residents of #CA25 effected by #BOBCATFIRE Fire in the Antelope Valley the Evacuation Site is @ Palmdale HS and remains active and receiving clients.   TY to the @PalmdaleCity for providing transportation support for residents needing transportation to their assigned hotel. https://t.co/fShyDetund
https://t.co/tGNhMDBF33

4/4 We have the Air Force to thank for standing up the @SpaceForceDoD which we hope finds a home in our beautiful 25th district as well.   Again Happy Birthday USAF and thank you for building stronger leaders to answer the Nation's call!
3/4 California's 25th District has a special connection to the USAF. In our beautiful Antelope Valley stands @EdwardsAFB. A beacon of ingenuity technology and sheer strength.
2/4 Men and Women of past and present have shown their courage and integrity protecting our freedoms; some giving the ultimate sacrifice. For that we owe them our eternal gratitude.

1/4 Today we wish the @usairforce a Happy Birthday. It has been 73 years since the establishment of an independent air Force and over the last 73 years our Air Force has made us proud. https://t.co/kNbBfZfPzt

3/3 W/in this renewal of national pride we need to think big stand up & wave the American flag w/ honor & be courageous in the face of stupendous challenges. I am the American dream. But at my core I am a patriot & the responsibility & role I cherish most is being an American.

2/3 I had the opportunity to address the audience & speak to one of the 3 central pillars of this contract with the American people; Renewing the American Dream. I believe we as a nation are too strong we have too much potential to limit ourselves to simple hopes & small dreams.

1/3 This morning I stood on the East Steps of the Capitol Building with @GOPLeader Kevin McCarthy Republican Whip @SteveScalise House Republican Conference Chair @RepLizCheney and members of the House GOP to rollout their Commitment to America. https://t.co/2cjVk9g4sR

2 of 2 These letters will start going out on September 24th.   Our office can help! The deadline to claim your economic impact payment is October 15th. If you live in California's 25th district contact one of our three offices Monday - Friday between 9 am - 5 pm.

1 of 2 An estimated 9 million people still haven't collected the first economic impact payment promised under the CARES Act.  The IRS announced that it is mailing letters to Americans who have not yet gone online to determine whether they're eligible for a stimulus payment. https://t.co/KFgN39CdFI
5 of 5 This wildfire roundtable was a significant opportunity to discuss what we truly need and our priorities to have complete fire suppression efficacy. We will host more events on a regular basis
4 of 5 Brush clearance controlled burns and more fixed-wing assets earlier in these fights. This is what needs to be done to achieve efficacy in fire suppression in California.
3 of 5 We need to fight these fires like we are waging combat: With overwhelming force. The resources we have are well managed; however we need more and we need to do more.

2 of 5 Our focus was to advance the alignment between all levels of government as we enter the heart of the envelope to ensure we are getting the right resources to the right battlefronts in a timely fashion for the 25th District.

1 of 5 Tonight I hosted the USDA Natural Resources & Environment Under Secretary James Hubbard at the Command Center for Lake Fire with State Senator @ScottWilkCA & Representatives from the @Angeles_NF @LACoFDPIO supervisor @kathrynbarger's Office & @TomLackey36’s Office. https://t.co/6juYFMriep

4 of 4 Santa Clarita is a great place to live thanks to our local law enforcement's hard-working men and women. We need to honor them and fight for their funding at all levels of government.   Thank you SCV Captain Diez for the great tour! #thinblueline #DefendThePolice

3 of 4 The sheriffs would take a hit to the gang units specialists such as rape investigators homeless programs and programs that keep our precious youth engaged in positivity community activities like those in Val Verde (YAL Program).
2 of 4 Captain Diez and I discussed the implications of the funding cuts threatened by the county in November.

1 of 4 I had the privilege to tour the Santa Clarita Valley Sheriff station Monday with Captain Diez and Lt Lasko.   The sheriffs in SCV are doing a fantastic job protecting us and helping our youth. https://t.co/cmUeVwYSNV
4 of 4 It was my honor and privilege to present the Gold Valor Award to Cadet Technical Sergeant Matthew Harrison. #saugusstrong https://t.co/MRzbAFlvwd

3 of 4 And for the students who effectively experienced the terror of combat in the sanctuary of their campus we cannot let this happen again. But in this case Harrison demonstrated the courage to act and in doing so saved a precious life.

2 of 4 Matthew Harrison distinguished himself with acts of gallantry and intrepidity above and well beyond the call of duty of a high school student. My heart breaks for all of the victims and their families.

1 of 4 As we are all still healing from the tragic events on the campus of my alma mater @SaugusHigh School that occurred on the 14th of November of last year today we paid tribute to one of the amazing heroes who took valiant action to save a fellow student’s life. https://t.co/LbbOf0hMRg

2 of 4 Matthew Harrison distinguished himself with acts of gallantry and intrepidity above and well beyond the call of duty of a high school student. My heart breaks for all of the victims and their families.

Measure like these are critically important to improving customer service for #Veterans using the VA.  The current interfaces of the VA health system are outdated and are causing many of the unnecessary delays Vets are experiencing still today. https://t.co/1SC3FeGUBl

Today I sent a letter to President @realDonaldTrump asking him to give full consideration to CA’s request for a major disaster declaration. #CA25 and all of CA were hit hard by the recent fires and we must ensure that every resource is being made available to our communities. https://t.co/ixJccGN8LK
Gunnery Sergeant Diego Pongo USMC (July 19 1985 – March 8 2020). May God Bless Diego and be with his family during this most difficult time.

Gunnery Sergeant Diego Pongo is survived by his daughter (Avery) his ex-wife (Ms. Randi Savage) his mother and father (Ms. Kathryn Steffen and Mr. Carlos Pongo) and his two brothers and their wives (Jorge and Jenna Pongo & Andres and Andrea Pongo).
the Global War on Terrorism Expeditionary Medal the Global War on Terrorism Service Medal and four Sea Service Deployment Ribbons.

the Navy and Marine Corps Achievement Medal the Combat Action Ribbon with Gold Star in lieu of 2nd award the Army Valorous Unit Award the Good Conduct Medal with 3 Bronze Stars two Humanitarian Service Medals the National Defense Medal...

Here he performed the duties of the Regional Operations Chief. Gunnery Sergeant Pongo’s awards include the Bronze Star Medal with Combat “V” the Purple Heart the Navy and Marine Corps Commendation Medal with Gold Star in lieu of 2nd award...

Gunnery Sergeant Diego Pongo enlisted into the United States Marine Corps in October of 2004. He was assigned to Golf Company 2nd Marine Raider Battalion under the Marine Special Operations Command in 2011 and ultimately was assigned to the Marine Raider Regiment in 2017.

We must never forget that there are men and women deployed overseas that are placing themselves in danger every day in defense of the freedoms that we enjoy here at home. May God bless them all and may he embrace Diego in the warmth of his unending love.

While #CA25 mourns his loss we also give thanks for his selfless sacrifice and the sacrifices of his family. Gunnery Sergeant Diego Pongo represents the best of us and will forever be remembered as a true American hero and patriot.

Today I was humbled & honored to attend a funeral service in honor of Gunnery Sergeant Diego Pongo USMC in Arlington National Cemetery with his family. The Pongos are residents of Simi Valley. Diego was a true hero to our nation & was killed in action on March 8 2020 in Iraq.

One of the highest honors and duties I have as your Congressman is spending time with and paying tribute to the families of service members who have made the ultimate sacrifice in defense of our nation. https://t.co/UjdOYHF5UG

Today I joined @GOPLeader NASA Administrator @JimBridenstine & small businesses from across Southern California to discuss the different opportunities available to those small businesses through @NASA’s #ArtemisProgram. Thanks to the nearly 150 constituents who participated! https://t.co/3uq4OGMJIM

After all #CA25 we’re living in the United States of America not Venezuela. This op-ed from the Wall Street Journal highlights the risks that anti-fossil fuel mandates bring with them especially as we enter the height of wildfire season. https://t.co/Z5EDrMy3B7

For too long Californians in #CA25 have had to live with destructive ideologically-driven energy policies that call into question the reliability and accessibility of our energy grids. We shouldn’t be subjected to policies that drive prices up & increase energy shortages.
Attention #CA25 – CAISO has declared a warning due to low power reserves & high demand for electricity on the grid. This warning is in effect until 11:59 pm PDT tonight.

Attention #CA25 — please take note of the evacuation point below. Also please keep all those continuing to battle the #LakeFire in your thoughts and prayers: @LACOFD @Angeles_NF @146AirliftWing @PalmdaleSheriff @RedCrossLA and so many others. https://t.co/9whwS2d2FE
Incident Command is reporting that the #LakeFire is pushing hard to the East with erratic fire behavior. They are a requesting immediate evacuation of ALL Lake Hughes. #CA25
Incident Command is reporting that the #LakeFire has made a 90 degree turn & is now pushing East. @LASDHQ is also reporting another road closure: Ridge Rte Road at Highway 138.
The @LASDHQ is announcing additional #LakeFire evacuations for the area of: east of Old Ridge Route west of 3 Point north of Pine Canyon south of Highway 138.
Incident Command is reporting that the #LakeFire is approximately 30 minutes from impacting homes on 205th Street W & Lancaster Road. They are sending additional assets to the desert floor.

Incident Command for #LakeFire is reporting a mile wide fire front now cresting the ridge & moving North-Northeast towards the desert. It is being categorized as “extreme fire behavior.” Please remain safe & keep our fire crews in your thoughts.

Incident Command for #LakeFire is reporting additional evacuations: Elizabeth Lake Road including all feeder streets between Lake Hughes Road & Trail Mountain View Road. @LASDHQ estimates approximately 100 homes total will be evacuated.

Attention all #CA25 constituents & media on Pine Canyon Road: #LakeFire Incident Command is requesting that you vacate the roadway. Emergency Fire Equipment needs to move freely in that area. Thank you for your understanding & willingness to help keep our fire crews safe.

Animal Care Services for #LakeFire:  Castiac Animal Care Center (31044 Charlie Canyon Rd) Lancaster Animal Care Center (5210 W. Avenue I) Palmdale Animal Care Center (38550 Sierra Highway) AV Fairgrounds - Large Animals Only (2551 W. Avenue H in Lancaster)

EVACUATION CENTER for #LakeFire has been set up at Highland High School (39055 25th Street West in Palmdale CA). Residents will be held in their vehicles. Small animals welcome but will remain in vehicles. No Animal Care services at this location. #CA25
Incident Command is reporting that the #LakeFire has crossed Pine Canyon Road & is established on that side of the roadway.

Incident Command is reporting that the #LakeFire is ready to cross Pine Canyon Road. MANDATORY EVACUATIONS are in place for everything north of Lake Hughes Road & Pine Canyon Road to the Desert Floor West to Three Points Road & Highway 138. Please remain safe #CA25!

Incident Command has set up an Evacuation Center for the #LakeFire at Highland High School (39055 25th Street West in Palmdale CA). If you live in this part of #CA25 please follow all guidance from local authorities & stay safe.
Incident Command is now reporting that the #LakeFire is threatening approximately 500 homes. Please evacuate if you are in the evacuation area. #CA25

Incident Command is reporting that the #LakeFire is now at 10000 acres with 0% containment. Fire is quickly approaching Pine Canyon Road. Please continue to follow all guidance from local authorities. Also please avoid the area so that fire crews can safely work. #CA25
Incident Command is reporting that #LakeFire is threatening additional structures. They are requesting more units. Fire is at 0% containment.
Please be aware of the following road closures due to the #LakeFire:  3 Points/Pine Canyon Highway 138/3 Points Ridge Route/Lake Hughes San Francisquito from Stater to Elizabeth Lake Road  #CA25
Incident Command is reporting that the #LakeFire is now at 7000 acres. Evacuations remain in place.
The @LASDHQ is reporting Pine Canyon Rd at Highway 138 is CLOSED as is everything west of Pine Canyon Rd on Lake Hughes Road is CLOSED.
Incident Command is reporting that the #LakeFire is now also making a hard push to the northwest towards the Three Points area. There is currently 0% containment.

SoCal Air Operations (@SocalAirOps) is reporting that the #LakeFire is currently between 6500 & 7000 acres with rapid rate of spread. They also are reporting 9 air tankers 9 copters & 4 helitankers are airborne. Please remain safe & follow guidance from officials. #CA25
Incident Command is reporting that the #LakeFire is now at 6500 acres and that there is an immediate for structure protection. #CA25

LA County Sheriffs (@LASDHQ) is reporting that evacuations have commenced for the area of Lake Hughes Rd west of Pine Canyon Rd and south of Dry Gulch Rd due to the #LakeFire. Please follow all guidance from local authorities for your safety as well as the safety of others. #CA25
Incident Command is now reporting that the #LakeFire is now at 6000 acres while continuing to move to the northeast in steep terrain. Evacuation plan is being formed.
Incident Command is now reporting that structures near Lake Hughes are now being threatened by #LakeFire
Incident Command is now reporting that #LakeFire has been updated to 400 acres with rapid movement to the northeast. There is now a Unified Command between @Angeles_NF and @LACOFD.

Incident Command is reporting that #LakeFire has a rapid rate of spread & the potential for 1000 acres. Local officials are still requesting evacuations of Lake Hughes north of the incident. Please continue to avoid the area for your safety & the safety of our fire crews.

Incident Command has designated this brush fire as #LakeFire & is reporting that 50+ acres currently engulfed with 20 mph winds. No structures in danger at this time. 2nd Alarm requested. Fire is currently 100% on federal land. Requesting evacuations north of Lake Hughes. #CA25

Attention #CA25 - Brush fire reported in #LakeHughes area between N. Lake Hughes Rd & Pine Canyon Rd. Full 1st Alarm brush assignment has been dispatched. Please avoid the area to let fire crews work safely. I’ll continue to monitor the situation & provide updates as appropriate.
Compromise for the people should not take this long. We need a bipartisan solution to the #COVID19 relief package that helps both small businesses and workers ASAP. No more politics.
Happy 230th Birthday to the @USCG. Their mission is vital to the security of our homeland and we are honored by their unwavering commitment. #SemperParatus https://t.co/u9LyJLtQcX
All lanes of the 14 Freeway are now open except for the Southbound right hand lane between Placerita Canyon Road and Newhall Avenue. #ElsmereFire
Incident Command is reporting that the #ElsmereFire is at 200 acres with 30% containment. The 14 Freeway Southbound is open except for the right hand lane. Northbound supposed to open shortly.
Incident Command is reporting that the #ElsmereFire is holding at 130 acres with 30% containment. The 14 Freeway remains closed.
Incident Command is reporting forward progress of the #ElsmereFire has stopped and that there is 30% containment.
Incident Command is reporting #ElsmereFire acreage at 130 acres after aircraft assessment.
Incident Command has rescinded the previous evacuation order & warning for the area of Newhall Valle de Oro Sierra and Dockweiler. NO EVACUATIONS IN PLACE AT THIS TIME for #ElsmereFire.

Attention #CA25: please avoid the area of the #ElsmereFire & allow first responders to work without interference. I hope all resources including large fixed-wing aircraft are being provided as needed for the safety of fire crews & our community. cc: @LACOFD @LACoFDPIO

As we welcome home these two American patriots we continue to look forward to future explorations to fulfill our quest to become a multi-planetary species. Congrats to @NASA @SpaceX & all those who worked tirelessly for years to ensure the success of this monumental mission.
American astronauts @AstroBehnken & @Astro_Doug are personifications of the American Spirit – their story much like our own is one of exploration and it is a story that we haven’t finished writing.

As Americans we carry an inherent desire to push ourselves forward through adversity. In mankind’s evolutionary journey from the caves to the moon & more recently to Mars there is no greater enemy to the American Spirit than complacency and self-doubt.

Moments ago @NASA astronauts @AstroBehnken & @Astro_Doug returned to Earth aboard the @SpaceX Crew Dragon Endeavour spacecraft. This craft lifted these two Americans from our soil a little more than two months ago to the @Space_Station & it has now brought them safely home.

FYSA: Around 1pm there will be 10 Blackhawk Helicopters flying over #CA25 for a training exercise. These training missions are vitally important to maintain the readiness required for our national security. Enjoy the sound of freedom & share the free air show w/ the kids!

Congratulations to @NASA Administrator @JimBridenstine @NASAJPL @ulalaunch and all of the men & women who dedicated the last ten years of their lives to this mission. You have honored our history and our nation's inherent desire to push forward towards the next journey.

Last night I spoke from the Floor of the House to celebrate the successful launch of @NASAPersevere Mars Rover. Yesterday's launch is a representation of the American Spirit and begins the next chapter of monumental exploration. WATCH my speech here: https://t.co/MtsTY12vlP

Today I was appointed to @HomelandGOP. I am honored to sit on this prestigious committee because there is no greater responsibility of the United States Congress than to ensure the security of our nation. I look forward to working with my colleagues towards that honorable goal.

Today I was able to pay my respects to @repjohnlewis as he was escorted to lie in state at the U.S. Capitol. A titan of the civil rights movement Rep. Lewis’ life should always be remembered & honored. I hope that he finds eternal peace & that light perpetual shines upon him. https://t.co/SJtg20Y7Vk
Tonight at 6pm is my first Congressional Townhall and it is not too late to RSVP. Make sure that you plan on participating! RSVP here: https://t.co/4aZJLSwA7z.

Today @GOPLeader & I sent a letter to @MLB Commissioner Manfred asking him to reconsider keeping the Lancaster @JetHawks @MiLB franchise affiliated with the MLB. As a JetHawks fan I know how valuable the team is to Lancaster & its local economy. Read the entire letter below: https://t.co/T3h2giSnEl

Tonight we passed the #NDAA in the face of bipartisan support and opposition. This bill wasn’t perfect but it was a step in the right direction to equip our warfighters for threats they face today. I proudly sponsored an amendment that passed that helps us prep for fire season. https://t.co/wqVWGzNyR1

While we remember the accomplishment of these two astronauts we must look towards the horizon with missions back to the moon and ultimately to Mars. America’s story is one of exploration and it is a story that we haven’t finished writing.

Fifty-one years ago today the world watched with bated breath as Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin stepped foot on the lunar surface. These historic steps represented an enduring testament to American innovation and our ability to work through challenging problems. https://t.co/GDLzFp2vej

This Thursday at 6pm I'm hosting my first Townhall. I’ll be sharing updates from my first 60 days in office successes that we have been able to secure for #CA25 and discussing important issues facing our community and our nation. To RSVP click here: https://t.co/4aZJLSwA7z.

The dedicated joint efforts of all stakeholders working this problem is impressive. I will continue to monitor these efforts and their forward progress so that the resulting safe land is something we are proud to have in #CA25. #NASA #DOE #Boeing #Tataviam @SYChumash https://t.co/XazPVu0qzg

Had a great visit to the Santa Susana Field Lab for a tour of the facilities. Learned about the ongoing cleanup activities & the Native American cultural resources that are on the grounds. Still a lot to do but the government & partners have rightfully prioritized the cleanup. https://t.co/mcIEEcwvPe

I am committed to ensuring their programs stay fully funded and that basic needs like clean water cellular reception and structures that could potentially fall during high winds are modernized. #NASA #DOD #Boeing #LockheedMartin #NorthropGrumman https://t.co/nGIBRlMHbS

I recently visited Plant 42 in Palmdale - a critical asset to national defense. Aerospace activities that utilize this area are a significant source of jobs & revenue to #CA25. But they need help to keep their programs whole & to ensure the infrastructure around them is improved https://t.co/9cgpPerOzT

We saw historic job numbers in June:  +2.1 million leisure & hospitality jobs;  +740000 retail jobs;  +568000 education & healthcare jobs;  +357000 service jobs; and  +356000 manufacturing jobs  Americans are ready to turn the lights back on and get back to work! https://t.co/k50cRhvFcI

In Case You Missed It: The Small Business Administration recently extended the deadline for Paycheck Protection Program applications. The new deadline to apply for a #PPP Loan is now August 8. https://t.co/uP6GHhToHb

That’s why I was proud to offer an amendment recently that would have reauthorized provisions meant to ensure a stable & reliable water supply for CA. Furthermore I am actively exploring funding opportunities for investments to recreational improvements at the Little Rock Dam.

I had the opportunity to tour the Palmdale Water District’s treatment plant.
